title: ASX climbs; tech takes a lead from Wall Street
text:
Vesna Poljak

The increasing leverage of US companies has got the attention of Bennelong Long Short Equity Management.

The growth in debt levels of US corporates as a share of gross domestic product has exceeded previous peaks in 2008-09 and the turn of the millennium, its listed investment company update says.

"The rise of corporate debt over the past decade has been understandable during a prolonged period of economic expansion and rising corporate profits. Further, the backdrop of low interest rate policies and QE supressing government bond yields has meant that debt service costs have remained low," the investment manager explains.

Despite this, the corporate bond spread remains low. "We wonder what the end game is for cheap debt, and how much further indebtedness can rise before risk appetite changes?"

Listed investment company Absolute Equity Performance Limited posted a 0.56 per cent portfolio return in August, for year-to-date performance of 0.65 per cent.
description: The ASX is off to a solid start, with tech stocks higher after Wall Street's Friday surge; Nathan Parkin of Ethical Partners talks Graincorp opportunity.
